metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The EAP-pwd server and peer implementation in hostapd and wpa_supplicant1.0 through 2.4 does not validate a fragment is already being processed,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory leak)via a crafted message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm2
wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm2
wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wpa package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-0ubuntu1.3').
